gw.api.web.payment

Class DirectBillPaymentFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.web.payment.DirectBillPaymentFactory

  • public class DirectBillPaymentFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    The place to go when you want to pay Direct Bill invoice items.

      Deprecated. 
      (Since 8.0.0) Use payFromDefaultUnapplied(gw.bc.account.entity.Account, gw.pl.currency.MonetaryAmount, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext) instead
      static DirectBillPayment payFromDefaultUnapplied(Account account, MonetaryAmount amount, DBPmntDistributionContext context)
      This method can be used instead of payFromUnapplied(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, gw.pl.currency.MonetaryAmount, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext) if the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds, and wishes to simply use default unapplied AccountStubI.getDefaultUnappliedFund()

      Pay Positive invoice items up to the amount of credits available.

      This method can be used as opposed to payUsingUpToAmountOfDesignatedUnapplied(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext) is the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds, and wishes to simply use default unapplied AccountStubI.getDefaultUnappliedFund()

    • Method Detail

      • pay

        public static DirectBillMoneyRcvd pay(Account account,
                      MonetaryAmount amount)
        Defaults to CASH payment with the account's unapplied t-account.
        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        amount - amount to pay
        Returns:
        the DirectBillMoneyRcvd that was created and executed. If this resulted in funds being distributed, the DirectBillMoneyRcvd that is returned will have an associated DirectBillPayment.

      • payUsingUpToAmountOfDefaultUnapplied

        public static DirectBillPayment payUsingUpToAmountOfDefaultUnapplied(@Nonnull
                                                     Account account,
                                                     @Nonnull
                                                     DBPmntDistributionContext context)
        This method can be used as opposed to payUsingUpToAmountOfDesignatedUnapplied(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext) is the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds, and wishes to simply use default unapplied AccountStubI.getDefaultUnappliedFund()
        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        context - the payment is being distributed in
        Returns:
        an executed and distributed credit distribution with amount of distribution up to the amount in default unapplied

      • payUsingUpToAmountOfAccountUnapplied

        @Deprecated
public static DirectBillPayment payUsingUpToAmountOfAccountUnapplied(@Nonnull
                                                                Account account,
                                                                @Nonnull
                                                                DBPmntDistributionContext context)
        Deprecated. (Since 8.0.0) Use payUsingUpToAmountOfDefaultUnapplied(gw.bc.account.entity.Account, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext) instead
        This method can be used as opposed to payUsingUpToAmountOfDesignatedUnapplied(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext) is the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds, and wishes to simply use default unapplied AccountStubI.getDefaultUnappliedFund()
        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        context - the payment is being distributed in
        Returns:
        an executed and distributed credit distribution with amount of distribution up to the amount in default unapplied

                                                        DBPmntDistributionContext context)
        Parameters:
        unappliedFund - The UnappliedFund to pay from unapplied from
        context - the payment is being distributed in @return an executed & distributed credit distribution with amount of distribution up to the amount in the unapplied T-account

      • payFromAccountUnapplied

        @Deprecated
public static DirectBillPayment payFromAccountUnapplied(@Nonnull
                                                   Account account,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   MonetaryAmount amount,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   DBPmntDistributionContext context)
        Deprecated. (Since 8.0.0) Use payFromDefaultUnapplied(gw.bc.account.entity.Account, gw.pl.currency.MonetaryAmount, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext) instead
        This method can be used instead of payFromUnapplied(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, gw.pl.currency.MonetaryAmount, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext) if the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds, and wishes to simply use default unapplied AccountStubI.getDefaultUnappliedFund()
        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        amount - to pay
        context - the payment is being distributed in
        Returns:
        an executed and distributed credit distribution with amount of distribution not exceeding the specified amount. null if no payment was executed.

      • payFromDefaultUnapplied

        public static DirectBillPayment payFromDefaultUnapplied(@Nonnull
                                        Account account,
                                        @Nonnull
                                        MonetaryAmount amount,
                                        @Nonnull
                                        DBPmntDistributionContext context)
        This method can be used instead of payFromUnapplied(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, gw.pl.currency.MonetaryAmount, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext) if the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds, and wishes to simply use default unapplied AccountStubI.getDefaultUnappliedFund()
        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        amount - to pay
        context - the payment is being distributed in
        Returns:
        an executed and distributed credit distribution with amount of distribution not exceeding the specified amount. null if no payment was executed.

      • payFromNegativeInvoiceItems

        public static DirectBillPayment payFromNegativeInvoiceItems(Account account,
                                            java.lang.Iterable<InvoiceItem> negativeInvoiceItems,
                                            DBPmntDistributionContext distributionContext)
        Pay Positive invoice items up to the amount of credits available. Restricted to the DistributionLimit set on the payer Account. Additionally, the DBPmntDistributionContexts "INVOICE BILLED" and "INVOICE DUE" will *only* distribute Up To Amount Billed, regardless of the Account's DistributionLimit setting.

        This method assumes the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds, and will simply use default unapplied AccountStubI.getDefaultUnappliedFund()

        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        negativeInvoiceItems - the negative invoice items to use as credits (i.e., source of funds), in addition to any that may be used under the Account's DistributionLimit setting
        distributionContext - the distribution context
        Returns:
        the executed and distributed direct bill payment holding the payment items. null if no payment was executed.

      • payPolicyPeriod

        public static DirectBillMoneyRcvd payPolicyPeriod(Account account,
                                  PolicyPeriod policyPeriod,
                                  MonetaryAmount amount)
        This method assumes the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds, and will simply use default unapplied AccountStubI.getDefaultUnappliedFund()
        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        policyPeriod - the target PolicyPeriod to pay
        amount - how much to pay towards invoice items for the specified PolicyPeriod
        Returns:
        an executed payment whose distribution items pay towards all eligible-to-be-paid items that belong to the specified PolicyPeriod.

      • createDirectBillPaymentofInvoice

        public static DirectBillPayment createDirectBillPaymentofInvoice(Account account,
                                                 Invoice invoice,
                                                 MonetaryAmount amount)
        Create a direct bill payment toward a specified invoice.
        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        invoice - the target invoice to pay
        amount - how much to pay towards invoice items for the specified invoice
        Returns:
        an executed payment whose distribution items pay towards all eligible-to-be-paid items that belong to the specified invoice.

      • createNewDirectBillPaymentForUI

        public static DirectBillPayment createNewDirectBillPaymentForUI(@Nonnull
                                                Account account,
                                                boolean isCreditDistribution)
        Create a DirectBillPayment with the account's unapplied t-account. TAccountOwner.getUnappliedAmount()

        If you wish to use a designated unapplied, use createNewDirectBillPaymentForUI(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, boolean)

        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        isCreditDistribution - whether the db payment should be a credit distribution
        Returns:
        an unexecuted and undistributed Direct Bill payment containing eligible dist items Note that this payment must be allocated before execution or the dist items will be lost

      • createNewDirectBillPaymentForUI

        public static DirectBillPayment createNewDirectBillPaymentForUI(@Nonnull
                                                UnappliedFund unappliedFund,
                                                boolean isCreditDistribution)
        Parameters:
        unappliedFund - The unappliedFund that is making the payment
        isCreditDistribution - whether the db payment should be a credit distribution
        Returns:
        an unexecuted and undistributed Direct Bill payment containing eligible dist items

      • createDirectBillPaymentForInvoiceItems

        public static DirectBillPayment createDirectBillPaymentForInvoiceItems(@Nonnull
                                                       DirectBillMoneyRcvd directBillMoneyRcvd,
                                                       java.lang.Iterable<InvoiceItem> invoiceItems)
        Parameters:
        directBillMoneyRcvd - source of the payment funds
        invoiceItems - the invoice items to target with the payment
        Returns:
        an unallocated direct bill payment containing the specified dist items. Note that this payment must be allocated before execution or the dist items will be lost

        Parameters:
        directBillMoneyRcvd - to use in the distribution
        Returns:
        a direct bill payment connected to the directBillMoneyRcvd

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • createDirectBillMoneyRcvd

        public static DirectBillMoneyRcvd createDirectBillMoneyRcvd(@Nonnull
                                            Account account,
                                            @Nonnull
                                            PaymentInstrument paymentInstrument,
                                            @Nonnull
                                            MonetaryAmount amount)
        Create a DirectBillMoneyRcvd with the account's unapplied t-account. TAccountOwner.getUnappliedAmount()

        If you wish to use a designated unapplied, use createDirectBillMoneyRcvd(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, gw.bc.payment.entity.PaymentInstrument, gw.pl.currency.MonetaryAmount)

        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        paymentInstrument - the payment instrument being used to pay
        amount - the amount to pay
        Returns:
        a directBillMoneyReceived

      • createZeroDollarDMR

        public static ZeroDollarDMR createZeroDollarDMR(@Nonnull
                                Account account)
        Creates a ZeroDollarDMR using the default unapplied fund of the given account.

        This method assumes that the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds. If you wish to use a desingated unapplied to make the ZeroDollarDMR use createZeroDollarDMR(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext, java.util.ArrayList)

        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        Returns:
        a zero dollar dmr

      • createZeroDollarDMR

        public static ZeroDollarDMR createZeroDollarDMR(@Nonnull
                                Account account,
                                @Nullable
                                DBPmntDistributionContext context,
                                @Nullable
                                java.util.ArrayList<InvoiceItem> relevantInvoiceItems)
        Creates a ZeroDollarDMR using the default unapplied fund of the given account.

        This method assumes that the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds. If you wish to use a desingated unapplied to make the ZeroDollarDMR use createZeroDollarDMR(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, gw.bc.invoice.typekey.DBPmntDistributionContext, java.util.ArrayList)

        Parameters:
        account - the payer account
        context - the DB Payment Distribution Context
        relevantInvoiceItems - the invoice items to this zero dollar dmr. Note that these are stored as a non-persistent field on the zero dollar dmr
        Returns:
        a zero dollar dmr

      • createZeroDollarDMR

        public static ZeroDollarDMR createZeroDollarDMR(@Nonnull
                                UnappliedFund unappliedFund,
                                @Nullable
                                DBPmntDistributionContext context,
                                @Nullable
                                java.util.ArrayList<InvoiceItem> relevantInvoiceItems)
        Creates a ZeroDollarDMR using the given UnappliedFund
        Parameters:
        unappliedFund - the UnappliedFund to use as the source of the credit distribution
        context - the DB Payment Distribution Context
        relevantInvoiceItems - the invoice items to this zero dollar dmr. Note that these are stored as a non-persistent field on the zero dollar dmr
        Returns:
        a zero dollar dmr

      • createAndExecuteMoneyReceivedFromAccountAndDirectBillMoneyDetails

        public static DirectBillMoneyRcvd createAndExecuteMoneyReceivedFromAccountAndDirectBillMoneyDetails(Account account,
                                                                                    DirectBillMoneyDetails moneyDetails)
        This method assumes the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds, and will use the given account's default unapplied fund. AccountStubI.getDefaultUnappliedFund()
        Parameters:
        account - the Account to make the payment to
        moneyDetails - information about the amount, payment method, check number, and other details associated with money
        Returns:
        an executed direct bill money received that respects the specified money details

      • createAndExecuteMoneyReceivedFromPaymentReceipt

        public static DirectBillMoneyRcvd createAndExecuteMoneyReceivedFromPaymentReceipt(Account account,
                                                                  PaymentReceipt paymentReceipt,
                                                                  java.util.Date receivedDate,
                                                                  java.lang.String description)
        This method assumes the user does not care about policy level or custom designated unapplieds, and will use the given account's default unapplied fund. AccountStubI.getDefaultUnappliedFund()

        If the user wishes to specify an unapplied fund, use createAndExecuteMoneyReceivedFromPaymentReceipt(gw.bc.accounting.entity.UnappliedFund, PaymentReceipt, Date, String)

        Parameters:
        account - the Account to make the payment to
        paymentReceipt - The payment information object that will be used to create a MoneyRcvd
        receivedDate - The date of the payment
        description - A description of the payment
        Returns:
        an executed direct bill money received that is synced to the specified payment method details

      • createAndExecuteMoneyReceivedFromPaymentReceipt

        public static DirectBillMoneyRcvd createAndExecuteMoneyReceivedFromPaymentReceipt(UnappliedFund unapplied,
                                                                  PaymentReceipt paymentReceipt,
                                                                  java.util.Date receivedDate,
                                                                  java.lang.String description)
        Create a DirectBillMoneyRcvd to the unapplied fund and execute the money received.
        Parameters:
        unapplied - The UnappliedFund to make the payment to
        paymentReceipt - The payment information object that will be used to create a MoneyRcvd
        receivedDate - The date of the payment
        description - A description of the payment
        Returns:
        an executed direct bill money received that is synced to the specified payment method details
